posts.post_content: This is the kind of card that *should* be printed in the core sets. Core sets are supposed to teach players things; specifically the need for removal and bounce spells, and the fact that even if nobody ever uses Platinum Angel, you have to assume they do.

Posted By: Minus_Prime (3/28/2011 1:57:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ntheawsome: [Into the Core](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Into the Core) says hi.  
@VampireCat: If the angel is your only creature, then [Gatekeeper of Malakir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gatekeeper of Malakir) says hi.  
  
It's tempting to try to come up with a way to protect this so you really can't ever lose, but it's also very, very hard, most likely impossible. The best I can come up with is the following:  
  
[Darksteel Forge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Darksteel Forge) to make it indestructible.  
[Leonin Abunas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leonin Abunas) or [Indomitable Archangel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Indomitable Archangel) to give it shroud.  
[Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) to make your shroud generator an artifact and therefore also indestructible (plus all the rest of your permanents for that matter.)  
[Tajuru Preserver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tajuru Preserver) so you won't have to sac it.  
[Treacherous Link](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Treacherous Link) so that any damage that still manages to be dealt to it isn't, even through anti-prevention effects (negates [Everlasting Torment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Everlasting Torment)/[Hurricane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hurricane) or similar, as well as ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

@ntheawsome: Into the Core says hi.
@VampireCat: If the angel is your only creature, then Gatekeeper of Malakir says hi.

It's tempting to try to come up with a way to protect this so you really can't ever lose, but it's also very, very hard, most likely impossible. The best I can come up with is the following:

Darksteel Forge to make it indestructible.
Leonin Abunas or Indomitable Archangel to give it shroud.
Mycosynth Lattice to make your shroud generator an artifact and therefore also indestructible (plus all the rest of your permanents for that matter.)
Tajuru Preserver so you won't have to sac it.

posts.post_content:
I don't think people give this enough credit. Yes, it "dies to removal" even more than your average creature does, but there are plenty of ways to protect it, especially in M11. I drafted one of these in a mono-blue control deck I put together and they couldn't even touch it.  
  
Maybe i'm a bit biased, as this is the first mythic rare I ever opened, and it was shiny, too.

posts.post_content:
So, I had this card out; I was at -2 life and 3 poison counters, then someone tried to Dispatch it, I vines of vastwood and win the next turn.  
  
But before I drew vines...  
  
 I was holding on to like 14 mana (including elves), but I only had 2 Artisans of Kozilek in my had and a Not of the world, had to save 7 mana so I could cast not of the world to protect the angel before I drew the vines of vastwood, which after I drew it I immediately played artisan and brought back primeval titan. Then won the next turn with the eldrazi I had cast (kozliek, which I drew into after we kept passing to draw.)  
  
The guy needed a smoke after that game. hah.  
  
This card wins me so many games, I only need a few turns after it comes out. This card is amazing! I'm so sad to see it cycling out. - But then again, same for Eldrazis - But then again, when they were in I thought Annihilator was ridiculous. 0 So sad to see them go, but expected it)  
  
This card, the angel; if used right in the current block; is very ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Totema (8/15/2011 5:55:19 PM)

posts.post_content:
A lot of people keep saying how many different ways you can destroy this card. Yeah there are ways, but its the same for ever other card, there is always a way to get rid of it. A platinum angel was the very first magic card the I ever owned, so I have had a lot of experience with how to destroy and protect one.  
Ive got an entire deck based around Platinum Angel, its a pure artifact deck too (the recent Mirrodin block was announced a week after I made it, talk about raining on my parade)  
While there are plenty of ways to destroy the card, there are plenty of ways to protect it as well.

Posted By: Arachibutyrophobia (8/13/2011 7:01:30 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Disappointed they didn't bring this back. This card, to me, is like the definition of what a core card should be. No it's not as wet-your-pants awesome as you initially think, but lemmie put this into perspective. I started back in Urza's Legacy but didn't really start tournament play until Onslaught, so I missed a lot of good cards or strategies. When I saw this card previewed in Mirrodin that far back, it threw me for a loop, same with [Mindslaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindslaver), among other things, because it was like they bending the very nature of the game I knew. Getting this from the beginning introduces you to a very interesting level of game mechanics while still remaining very basic.  
  
To top it off, it also makes people learn how to protect their stuff. You get this as a kid or a starting player and your initial reaction might be something in the realm of "OOOH! THIS IS AWESEOM!" only to have it [Naturalize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Naturalize)d or [Nature's Claim](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nature's Claim)ed. So you suddenly ha... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
